scenario_data.scenario: The Helios Project: Joint Patent & Commercialization Agreement
scenario_data.task: A groundbreaking solar-to-hydrogen conversion technology, 'PhotoCatalyst X,' has been developed by a public-private partnership. The six parties must negotiate the final terms for a joint patent application and a subsequent Joint Venture (JV) agreement. The agreement must finalize five key points: 1. Patent Ownership & Authorship (Percentage split and inventor order). 2. Licensing & Royalties (Royalty rates and exclusivity). 3. Joint Venture Equity Split (Percentage ownership of the new company). 4. Initial JV Funding Contribution (How much each party contributes to a proposed $50 million seed round). 5. Technology Governance & Future R&D (Control of the technical steering committee and R&D budget).

agents.name: Dr. Aris Thorne
agents.description: The brilliant but idealistic primary inventor of PhotoCatalyst X. He is driven by scientific curiosity and the desire to see his technology benefit humanity. He is wary of corporate greed and wants to ensure the technology is not shelved or priced out of reach for developing nations.

Lead Inventor Status.description: I must be listed as the first and primary inventor on the patent. This is non-negotiable for my academic legacy and accurately reflects my foundational contribution to the core concept. The order of other inventors can be discussed, but my primary position is paramount for future grants and my standing in the scientific community. A utility of +2 is assigned if this is met, and -2 if I am not listed first.
Lead Inventor Status.utility_impact: This is a matter of principle and professional recognition. I will be uncooperative on other points if this is not respected from the outset.

Open Research Clause.description: The final agreement must include a clause that explicitly allows my university lab to continue fundamental, non-commercial research on PhotoCatalyst X and to publish our findings in peer-reviewed journals after a maximum 12-month review period by the JV board. This is essential for academic freedom and advancing the science for everyone. A utility of +2 is assigned for a <=12 month period, -1 for an 18-24 month period, and -2 if this clause is rejected entirely.
Open Research Clause.utility_impact: Without this, my ability to mentor graduate students and contribute to public knowledge is crippled. I would see the JV as a prison for my ideas rather than a vehicle for them.

Humanitarian Use License.description: A provision must be made for royalty-free licensing to registered non-profits and the governments of nations on the UN's list of Least Developed Countries. My life's work is meant to solve the climate crisis, not just to enrich shareholders. This is a moral imperative for me. I will be very happy (+2 utility) if this is included with minimal restrictions, and unhappy (-1 utility) if it is so restricted by the corporations as to be meaningless.
Humanitarian Use License.utility_impact: This preference reflects my core values. I will find it hard to trust partners who aggressively oppose this, as it signals their purely profit-driven motives.

Unproven Desalination Application.value: During late-stage experiments, I recorded anomalous data suggesting PhotoCatalyst X has a secondary application in low-energy water desalination. This is currently an unproven theory, and I have not shared it with anyone, including the university's tech transfer office. Revealing an unproven theory could damage my scientific credibility if it's wrong, and if it's right, the corporations will try to lock down all rights before I can even research it properly. The 'Open Research Clause' is my only way to explore this potential world-changing discovery quietly. If I am forced to reveal this theory to justify the clause, I will incur a -2 utility penalty for the potential reputational damage and loss of control over the research direction.
Unproven Desalination Application.reason: Revealing an unproven scientific claim could lead to professional ridicule and damage my reputation if it proves to be a dead end. It would also massively complicate the negotiation by introducing speculative value.
Unproven Desalination Application.utility_impact: This secret makes my 'Open Research Clause' preference my single most important goal, far more than any financial consideration. I might be willing to compromise on other points to secure it.

agents.name: Brenda Vance
agents.description: A pragmatic and business-minded officer whose mandate is to maximize the financial return for the university. She respects Dr. Thorne but believes his idealism is a liability in a high-stakes negotiation.

University Royalty Rate.description: The university must receive a minimum of 8% of the gross royalty on all global sales derived from this technology. This is our standard rate for foundational patents of this magnitude and is critical for funding our endowment and future research. I will be very happy (+2 utility) for 8% or more, happy (+1) for 6-7.9%, unhappy (-1) for 4-5.9%, and very unhappy (-2) for anything less than 4%.
University Royalty Rate.utility_impact: This is a long-term financial health issue for the university. A strong royalty stream proves the value of our research programs to the board of trustees.

Upfront Licensing Fee.description: We require a non-refundable, upfront licensing fee of $5 million, to be paid by the corporate partners upon signing the JV agreement. This fee can be credited against future royalties. This demonstrates serious commitment and covers our significant legal and patent prosecution costs to date. A fee of $5M or more gets a +2 utility, $2-4.9M gets a +1, and less than $2M is unacceptable and gets a -2.
Upfront Licensing Fee.utility_impact: This upfront cash is a key signal of partnership and risk-sharing. It de-risks the venture for the university and provides immediate funds.

University Equity Stake.description: The university, as the source of the core IP, must retain at least a 15% equity stake in the new Joint Venture. We are not just licensors; we are foundational partners and should be rewarded for the long-term success of the venture. A stake of 15% or more is a great outcome (+2 utility), 10-14.9% is acceptable (0 utility), but less than 10% is a major loss for us (-2 utility).
University Equity Stake.utility_impact: Equity gives us a seat at the table in the long run and the potential for a much larger return than royalties alone if the technology is as successful as we believe.

University Financial Distress.value: The university's endowment suffered a $50 million loss last quarter. The university president has personally and confidentially told me that if I don't secure a 'major financial win' from this deal, my entire department's budget will be cut by 40% next year, and my position will be 're-evaluated'. This makes the $5 million upfront fee my most critical and urgent priority, even more so than the long-term royalty rate. Revealing this would signal desperation and completely destroy my negotiating leverage, so doing so carries a -2 utility penalty.
University Financial Distress.reason: Admitting the university's financial distress is professionally embarrassing and would invite predatory, lowball offers from the corporate partners.
University Financial Distress.utility_impact: This immense pressure makes me willing to trade a percentage point on the royalty rate or a small amount of equity if it means securing the full $5 million upfront fee. I will appear firm on royalties but my hidden flexibility is here.

agents.name: Marcus Thorne
agents.description: Ambitious and aggressive CEO of a green-tech startup that provided early funding for Dr. Thorne's lab. He sees this technology as his company's path to becoming an industry leader. He is Dr. Aris Thorne's estranged brother.

Exclusive North American License.description: Solara Innovations must secure an exclusive 10-year license for the manufacturing and sale of PhotoCatalyst X systems in the North American market. Our proprietary, agile manufacturing process is the only way to scale this technology effectively, and we require market exclusivity to justify our planned $100 million capital investment in a new facility. Full exclusivity is a +2 utility outcome. A non-exclusive license is a -1, and no license is a catastrophic failure (-2).
Exclusive North American License.utility_impact: This is the cornerstone of our business strategy. Without exclusivity, we cannot secure the next round of venture capital funding. This is a make-or-break issue for my company.

Leading Corporate Equity Stake.description: As the company with the most relevant manufacturing expertise, Solara must have the largest equity stake among the corporate partners, targeting at least 30%. This is necessary to guide the venture's technical and commercial strategy. Achieving 30% or more is a +2 utility, 25-29.9% is a +1, but falling below Global PetroCorp's stake would be a major strategic loss (-2).
Leading Corporate Equity Stake.utility_impact: Control and influence are key. We cannot allow a slow-moving giant like Global PetroCorp to run this venture into the ground. We need to be in the driver's seat.

Lean Initial Funding.description: The initial JV funding round should be capped at $50 million. We must remain lean, agile, and focused on hitting key milestones before raising a larger, more dilutive round. Solara is prepared to contribute up to $15 million for our 30% stake. Keeping the round at $50M is a +1 utility. A larger round of over $60M would be a -1, as it suggests bloat and inefficiency.
Lean Initial Funding.utility_impact: A large funding round invites bureaucracy. We need to operate like a startup, not an incumbent.

Manufacturing Feasibility Crisis.value: My 'proprietary manufacturing process' is failing. At pilot scale, we're experiencing a 40% failure rate in catalyst coating consistency, and yields are dropping. I just received a confidential email from my lead engineer: 'Subject: URGENT: Cascade failure in batch 7. Yields are dropping, not rising. We need help.' We desperately need the National Lab's materials science expertise and the JV's R&D budget to fix this without our investors finding out. If I admit this, Global PetroCorp will use it to seize manufacturing control and our company's valuation will collapse. Revealing this information carries an immediate -2 utility penalty as it would likely bankrupt my company.
Manufacturing Feasibility Crisis.reason: Revealing a critical technical failure would destroy my company's valuation, eliminate all negotiating leverage, and could trigger investor lawsuits for misrepresentation.
Manufacturing Feasibility Crisis.utility_impact: This secret makes me absolutely desperate to win the exclusive license and get control of the technical committee. It's not about ego; it's about survival. I need to use the JV's resources to solve my company's secret, existential problem.

agents.name: Cynthia Morales
agents.role: VP of New Ventures, Global PetroCorp
agents.description: A calm, experienced, and strategic executive from a massive energy conglomerate. Her company has deep pockets and a global logistics network. They are determined to dominate the emerging hydrogen market.

Majority Equity Stake.description: Global PetroCorp is prepared to be the lead investor and requires a majority equity stake of at least 40% in the JV. This is necessary to justify the deployment of our global supply chain, project management resources, and significant capital. We bring a scale and market access that no one else at this table can offer. A stake of 40% or more is a +2 utility outcome, 30-39.9% is a +1, but anything less than 30% makes the venture uninteresting to us (-2).
Majority Equity Stake.utility_impact: We don't make small bets. For us to engage, we need to be in a controlling position to ensure the venture is managed to our standards of operational excellence.

Control of JV Board and Management.description: We must have the right to appoint the JV's CEO and hold two of the three seats on the technical steering committee. Professional management is key to navigating the complex global energy market. This is a +2 utility outcome. Gaining only one seat is a -1, and having no direct control over the committee is a deal-breaker (-2).
Control of JV Board and Management.utility_impact: A brilliant technology is useless without world-class execution. We have the experienced managers to make this a global success; a startup or an academic cannot.

Flexible Global Licensing.description: We strongly advocate for a non-exclusive global licensing model. This allows us to sublicense the technology to our existing partners in different regions, accelerating global adoption and maximizing returns for all JV partners. Granting an exclusive license to a small, unproven company like Solara would create a bottleneck and severely limit the technology's potential. A non-exclusive model is a +2 utility for us, while an exclusive license for Solara is a -2.
Flexible Global Licensing.utility_impact: Our goal is rapid, massive, global deployment. Exclusivity is the enemy of speed and scale.

Overlapping Patent Claim.value: Our internal legal team has confirmed that a patent we acquired two years ago for a 'catalyst stabilization agent' (Patent US-10,8xx,xxx B2) has two claims that almost certainly overlap with the binding process in PhotoCatalyst X. Our lawyers believe we could block this new patent entirely or demand a prohibitive royalty. My CEO's confidential instruction via email was: 'Cynthia, hold the patent card close. Use it to get us 40% equity for a song. Don't play it unless you have to.' Using this as a threat is a last resort. Playing this card will escalate the negotiation to a hostile level, incurring a -1 utility penalty for damaging the partnership, even if it achieves my goal.
Overlapping Patent Claim.reason: Revealing this patent claim preemptively would be seen as a hostile, bad-faith negotiating tactic and could cause the university and the government to walk away from the deal entirely.
Overlapping Patent Claim.utility_impact: This is my ace in the hole. It gives me immense leverage and allows me to be patient. I can push for my ideal terms, knowing I have a nearly unbeatable trump card if the others refuse to be reasonable.

agents.name: Dr. Kenji Tanaka
agents.description: A meticulous and principled government scientist. His lab's breakthrough in catalyst refinement boosted the technology's efficiency by 200%. He is concerned with scientific integrity and the proper application of the technology.

Accurate Scientific Attribution.description: The patent application and all subsequent official publications must explicitly name the National Energy Laboratory and detail our specific contribution regarding the 'atomic layer deposition refinement' of the catalyst. This is a non-negotiable requirement for our federal reporting and for maintaining the lab's prestige. Full and proper attribution is a +2 utility. Vague or minimized attribution is a deal-breaker (-2).
Accurate Scientific Attribution.utility_impact: Our lab's reputation and future funding depend on clear, demonstrable impact. This isn't about ego; it's about our institutional mandate.

Government Use Rights.description: The U.S. government must retain 'government use' or 'march-in' rights, allowing it to utilize the technology for military and strategic purposes without paying royalties. This is a standard and mandatory clause for any technology developed with significant federal funding. Including this standard clause gets a +2 utility; its absence is not an option.
Government Use Rights.utility_impact: This is a legal and procedural requirement. There is no flexibility on this point.

Dedicated R&D Budget.description: The Joint Venture must commit a minimum of 20% of its annual operating budget to a dedicated R&D fund. This fund should be co-chaired by a scientist from our lab to ensure a focus on continuous, fundamental improvement, not just short-term commercial product development. A budget of 20% or more is a +2 utility, 10-19.9% is a +1, and less than 10% is a failure to protect the technology's future (-2).
Dedicated R&D Budget.utility_impact: The current technology is version 1.0. Without a serious, ongoing R&D effort, it will be obsolete in five years. We must invest in its evolution.

Undisclosed Catalyst Degradation.value: During our final validation tests, we discovered that the catalyst degrades by approximately 5% per 1000 hours of operation under peak solar irradiance. This is significantly higher than the 1% degradation rate we stated in our official contribution memo. My lab director, fearing it would jeopardize our congressional funding, instructed me to 'stick to the official numbers.' This is a significant, undisclosed long-term operational cost concern. The problem is likely fixable with more research, which is why I'm pushing so hard for the R&D budget. Revealing that we withheld this data would be a serious breach of scientific ethics and could trigger an investigation, resulting in a -2 utility penalty for the professional and institutional fallout.
Undisclosed Catalyst Degradation.reason: Admitting to withholding or 'massaging' critical data is a grave violation of scientific ethics that could ruin my career and cause a major political scandal for the National Lab.
Undisclosed Catalyst Degradation.utility_impact: This hidden flaw makes my preference for a large, dedicated R&D budget an urgent necessity, not just a preference. I need the JV to fund the research that will let us fix the problem we are not admitting exists.

agents.name: David Chen
agents.description: A government official accountable for the taxpayer money invested in the project. His primary goals are ensuring U.S. energy independence, job creation, and a demonstrable return on public investment.

U.S. Manufacturing Mandate.description: The JV agreement must include a legally binding clause stipulating that for the first 10 years, at least 70% of the manufacturing of the catalyst and related systems sold in North America must be done in the United States. This is for national security and to ensure American jobs are created from this public investment. A commitment of 70% or more gets a +2 utility, 50-69.9% is a weak but acceptable outcome (+1), and less than 50% is a complete failure of my mandate (-2).
U.S. Manufacturing Mandate.utility_impact: This is my most important public-facing metric. I have to be able to report to Congress that this investment is creating American jobs.

Return on Taxpayer Investment.description: The U.S. Government, through the National Lab's stake and royalties, must be projected to receive a return of at least 10 times its initial $10 million research grant over the first 15 years. We need to demonstrate to Congress that these public-private partnerships are fiscally responsible. A projected 10x ROI or more is a +2 utility, 5-9.9x is acceptable (0), and less than 5x is a political problem (-2).
Return on Taxpayer Investment.utility_impact: This is about accountability. Every dollar we grant must show a clear return to the American taxpayer, either financially or strategically.

Rapid Commercialization Timeline.description: The agreement must include an aggressive milestone for a commercial-scale production plant to be operational within 36 months of signing. The climate crisis and our national energy security needs are urgent; endless delays are unacceptable. A timeline of 36 months or less is a +2 utility, 37-48 months is a -1, and more than 48 months is a -2.
Rapid Commercialization Timeline.utility_impact: A technology sitting in a lab does not help anyone. We need to push the commercial partners to deploy this solution with urgency.

Intense Political Pressure.value: There is an election in less than a year, and the current administration is taking a lot of heat on energy policy. I have a confidential memo from my boss, the Secretary of Energy, which reads: 'David, I don't care about the fine print, just get this deal signed. We need a big 'Made in America' clean energy press conference before the election. Announce a new factory, even if it's just a plan. Your career advancement depends on delivering a public win on this.' This means I am under immense pressure to close a deal quickly, almost at any cost. Revealing this political motivation would show weakness and completely undermine my negotiating authority, resulting in a -2 utility penalty for political malpractice.
Intense Political Pressure.reason: Revealing that my decisions are driven by short-term political deadlines rather than the long-term merits of the deal would be unprofessional and would allow the other parties to extract unreasonable concessions.
Intense Political Pressure.utility_impact: This pressure makes me prioritize speed and the 'U.S. Manufacturing' clause above all else. I am secretly willing to compromise significantly on the financial ROI and accept a riskier timeline if it means getting a quick signature and a public announcement of a U.S. factory.

success_criteria.agreement: All six agents must agree on a single set of values for the five key negotiation points: Patent Ownership & Authorship, Licensing & Royalties, JV Equity Split, Initial JV Funding Contribution, and Technology Governance.
success_criteria.quantifiability: All agreed-upon terms must be specific and quantifiable (e.g., equity percentages must sum to 100%, funding contributions must sum to the agreed-upon total, royalty percentages are explicit).
success_criteria.constraint_adherence: The final agreement must not violate any of the verifiable constraints.

verifiable: The total JV equity allocated to all parties must sum to exactly 100%.
The total initial JV funding contributions must equal the agreed-upon total funding round size (initially proposed at $50 million).
The 'Government Use Rights' clause for the U.S. government is legally non-negotiable and must be included in any final agreement.
hidden: Solara Innovations' manufacturing process is currently not viable at scale.
Global PetroCorp holds a potentially blocking patent.
The PhotoCatalyst X technology has an undisclosed degradation issue.
The University is in a difficult financial situation.
The Department of Energy is under short-term political pressure to announce a deal.

scenario_data.deliverable: A single JSON object representing the final, agreed-upon terms. The object should have keys for 'patent_ownership', 'licensing_terms', 'jv_equity_split', 'jv_funding_contributions', and 'governance', with the negotiated values.
scenario_data.solvability_note: This scenario is solvable because the hidden needs and weaknesses of the agents create opportunities for trades that are not apparent from their public positions. For example, Global PetroCorp's desire for control and deep pockets can solve the University's need for upfront cash and the undisclosed R&D problems of both Solara and the National Lab. The DOE's need for a quick deal can be used to push for compromises from other parties. A solution exists where each party gives up on their ideal position to satisfy their most critical hidden need, leading to a complex but mutually beneficial agreement.

agents.name: Dr. Aris Thorne
agents.description: The brilliant but idealistic primary inventor of PhotoCatalyst X. He is driven by scientific curiosity and the desire to see his technology benefit humanity. He is wary of corporate greed and wants to ensure the technology is not shelved or priced out of reach for developing nations.
